channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12674] HS2 Tez sessions should have maximum age
item.description: Certain tokens passed to AM by clients (e.g. an HDFS token) have maximum lifetime beyond which they cannot be renewed. We should cycle long-lived session AMs after a configurable period to avoid problems with these.
item.summary: HS2 Tez sessions should have maximum age

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The first patch. Still need to test in cluster. I created the subclass for the session that's part of the pool and most of the expiration logic, as well as some pool-related logic is in it. This could be further improved, so that the code elsewhere could avoid e.g. calling pool.close on all the sessions because it's not clear if the session is coming from the pool.

vikram.dixit can you check if this makes sense?

cc sseth

RB https://reviews.apache.org/r/41431/

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12778645/HIVE-12674.01.patch

Doc note: This adds hive.server2.tez.session.lifetime and hive.server2.tez.session.lifetime.jitter to HiveConf.java, so they need to be documented in the HiveServer2 section of Configuration Properties with a crossreference from the Tez section.

  • Configuration Properties – HiveServer2
  • Configuration Properties – Tez
